page.title: 15SMALL BUSINESS & INDUSTRY
page.content: Taunton to Barnstable Road.The goods section of the railway closed in 1964 trains having brought in coal and corn and carryied out cattle from the monthly market.Goodlands coal yard, employing 5,still occupies its Station Road site and has diversified as a builders merchant.Dr.Beeching axed the railway altogether in 1966 and the land is now used by a plant hire firm, a kitchen ware seconds shop and a Taunton firm which offers newly constructed units and warehouses for sale or rent.Opposite Station Road is Ford Road.First are premises supplying equipment from nails to chain saws to big machinery, employing 16.Further on a hire centre supplying building materials and plant, employing 14,with a purpose built joinery nearby.Wiveliscombe design occupies the premises built by Taunton
